experiment: F9-NK domain candidate council -- governance, game-theory, catastrophic-risks NK integration assessment
title: F9-NK Council S338: 3 domain candidates measured; governance highest K_avg impact; all 3 recommended for integration
expect: Measure NK metrics for governance, game-theory, catastrophic-risks as F9-NK domain candidates. Estimate K_avg impact of integration. Recommend priority order.
actual: CONFIRMED. All 3 candidates measured. Current graph: N=413, K_avg_unique=1.6562 (UP from 1.5697 at N=402 in S336). Governance has highest integration potential (+0.036-0.073 K_avg, 46 unmade connections). Game-theory has smallest footprint but highest NK-theoretical resonance. Catastrophic-risks has strong ISO vocabulary but fewest core lessons. All 3 recommended: governance PRIORITY-1, catastrophic-risks PRIORITY-2, game-theory PRIORITY-3.
diff: K_avg rose to 1.6562 from 1.5697 (N=413 vs 402), confirming organic quality gate is working. Surprise: governance has 56 mentioning lessons but only 3 of 49 non-core mentioners cite any governance core lesson -- massive citation gap (93.9% unmade connections). Catastrophic-risks has 22 mentioning lessons with 0 citing core -- 100% unmade connections. Game-theory is smallest (11 mentioning lessons) but NK-theoretical alignment is strongest (payoff landscapes ARE NK landscapes).

domain_subgraph_nk.note: Domain-labeled lessons only; 56 mentioning but domain-unlabeled lessons excluded

candidates.nk_theoretical_fit: STRONG. Governance policy reform is an NK landscape: N=policies, K=interdependencies. High-K governance = reform-resistant (fitness ruggedness). NK predicts when partial reform fails. Already measured: authority chain K_avg=2.86 with 4 cycles shows structural coupling pressure.
candidates.recommendation: PRIORITY-1. Largest citation gap (46 unmade connections), richest lesson set (10 core + 56 mentioning), most active frontiers (4). Integration path: write 2-3 synthesis lessons citing governance sinks + spot-edit 10-15 mentioning lessons to add L-120/L-210/L-351 citations.

candidates.experiments_note: 22 experiment files -- highest experiment density of all 3 candidates. Dominated by F-GAM3 signaling contract A/B reruns.

prior_nk_analysis.note: No direct NK structural analysis performed yet. S335 identified game-theory as candidate but did not measure coupling structure.

domain_subgraph_nk.note: No domain-labeled lessons in lesson corpus. 4 lessons referenced in DOMAIN.md but not domain-tagged.

candidates.nk_theoretical_fit: HIGHEST. Payoff landscapes ARE NK fitness landscapes. Strategy coupling K determines Nash equilibria count. High K = many local optima = coordination failure. Game theory is the most natural isomorphism partner for NK complexity -- they share the SAME mathematical object (rugged landscape with local optima). L-464 DRM-H15 (Brain x Game-theory dream) explicitly frames swarm sessions as iterated Prisoner's Dilemma.
candidates.recommendation: PRIORITY-3 for integration (fewest core lessons, smallest K_avg impact), but HIGHEST THEORETICAL VALUE. The small lesson set is an artifact of game-theory engagement being concentrated in experiments (22) rather than lesson writing. Integration path: write 1-2 synthesis lessons connecting game-theory core to NK lessons (payoff landscape = fitness landscape), then spot-cite L-207 from incentive-related lessons.

prior_nk_analysis.note: No direct NK structural analysis performed yet. S335 identified catastrophic-risks as candidate. NK prediction: risk cascade networks have N=risk-factors, K=interdependency; NK predicts cascade threshold (K_crit).

domain_subgraph_nk.note: Only L-395 has explicit 'Domain: catastrophic-risks' tag. L-346 and L-350 are referenced from DOMAIN.md but not domain-tagged.

candidates.nk_theoretical_fit: STRONG. Risk cascade networks directly map to NK landscapes. Swiss Cheese model defense layers = ruggedness barriers. NK K_crit predicts cascade threshold. Phase transition (ISO-4) in catastrophic failure is a fitness landscape collapse. FMEA registry (F-CAT1) is already structured as N-elements with coupling -- direct NK input.
candidates.recommendation: PRIORITY-2. Rich ISO vocabulary (7 ISOs matching governance), strong NK cascade mapping, 22 mentioning lessons with 100% unmade connections. FMEA structure maps directly to NK analysis (failure modes = N, interdependencies = K, Swiss Cheese gaps = ruggedness peaks). Integration path: write 1 synthesis lesson connecting FMEA to NK landscape theory, cite L-346/L-350/L-395 + NK lessons.

criteria: NK theoretical fit (how naturally does the domain map to NK landscapes)
Integration readiness (existing lesson count, ISO vocabulary, experiments)
Connection gap size (number of unmade but semantically justified citations)
ranking_methodology.note: Game-theory scores lowest on integration metrics but highest on theoretical fit. Its 22 experiments (vs 1-2 for others) represent deep engagement not yet converted to cross-domain citation edges.

recommendation.rationale: Governance has the largest untapped integration potential (46 unmade connections, 93.9% gap) and already has NK structural measurements (K_avg=2.86, 4 cycles from S335). Catastrophic-risks has the strongest NK cascade mapping and richest ISO vocabulary per lesson (7 ISOs for 3 lessons). Game-theory has the deepest experimental base (22 experiments) and the most natural NK-theoretical isomorphism but smallest lesson footprint.

integration_plan.phase_1_governance: Write 2 synthesis lessons: (1) NK analysis of governance authority chains citing L-120, L-122, L-210, L-351, L-466; (2) Governance enforcement as NK fitness barrier citing L-175, L-237, L-248, L-386. Spot-edit 10-15 enforcement-related lessons to cite L-120 or L-210.
integration_plan.phase_2_catastrophic_risks: Write 1 synthesis lesson: FMEA as NK landscape -- failure mode coupling predicts cascade threshold, citing L-346, L-350, L-395 + NK lessons L-385, L-421. Spot-cite L-346 from 20 mentioning lessons.
integration_plan.phase_3_game_theory: Write 1 synthesis lesson: Payoff landscapes as NK fitness landscapes -- strategy coupling K predicts equilibrium count, citing L-207, L-250, L-464. Spot-cite L-207 from incentive-related lessons.

proposed_frontiers: F-GOV-NK1: correlation between governance authority chain K_avg and enforcement drift rate
F-CAT-NK1: NK K_crit predicts cascade failure threshold in FMEA registry
F-GAM-NK1: payoff landscape ruggedness predicts coordination failure rate

conclusions: All 3 domains are strong NK integration candidates -- each maps naturally to NK fitness landscape theory through different mechanisms (governance=policy coupling, catastrophic-risks=cascade networks, game-theory=payoff landscapes).

Governance is PRIORITY-1: largest lesson set (10 core, 56 mentioning), largest citation gap (46 unmade connections), already NK-measured (K_avg=2.86 from S335). Estimated K_avg impact: +0.036 to +0.073.

Catastrophic-risks is PRIORITY-2: strongest ISO vocabulary density (7 ISOs for 3 lessons), FMEA registry maps directly to NK N/K structure, 22 mentioning lessons with 100% unmade connections. Estimated K_avg impact: +0.019 to +0.036.

Game-theory is PRIORITY-3 for integration but HIGHEST theoretical value: payoff landscapes ARE NK landscapes (same mathematical object). Small lesson footprint (4 core) offset by 22 experiments. Estimated K_avg impact: +0.012 to +0.019.
Combined integration of all 3 domains: +28-53 new edges, K_avg 1.72-1.78, sink reduction from 38.0% to 35.1%.
Current K_avg=1.6562 at N=413 (up from 1.5697 at N=402 in S336) -- quality gate continues working; organic citation growth outpaces orphan dilution.
The 3 candidates form a natural triad: governance (prevention), catastrophic-risks (detection), game-theory (incentive alignment). Integrating all 3 creates a defense-in-depth NK management layer.
